title: Kevin Meates
text:
Kevin Francis Meates (born 20 February 1930) is a former New Zealand <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. A <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Flanker">flanker</a>, sometimes playing at <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Locks">lock</a>, Meates represented at a provincial level. He was a member of the New Zealand national side, the <a href="All%20Blacks">All Blacks</a>, in 1952, appearing in two internationals for the All Blacks against the <a href="1952%20Australia%20rugby%20union%20tour%20of%20New%20Zealand">touring Australian team</a> in 1952.
The younger brother of <a href="Bill%20Meates%20%28rugby%20union%29">Bill Meates</a>, another rugby player, Meates graduated from <a href="University%20of%20Canterbury">Canterbury University College</a> with a <a href="Bachelor%20of%20Science">Bachelor of Science</a> in 1952.
